alert.note: Alert for Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 6:44PM CST until March 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. White River At Georgetown affecting White, Prairie and Woodruff Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY, MARCH 09... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...White River At Des Arc. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday, March 09. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Many acres of farmland flooded within the levees. Water is backing up Bayou Des Arc and Cypress Bayou. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 23.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Action stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date White River Des Arc 24.0 23.1 Mon 6 PM 23.4 23.5 23.5 23.5 12 PM 3/02 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
